1.taskName: Select the book directly on a shelf
1.instructionSurName: Select direct children of an element  A > B
1.instruction: You can select elements that are direct children of other elements. A child element is any element that is nested directly in another element. Elements that are nested deeper than that are called descendant elements.
1.examples: A > B  selects all B  that are adirect children  A
1.HTMLviewer: <mat class='small moved' id='q5'> <flower class='small moved' id='q1'/> </mat>   <book id='q2'/>

2.instruction: The class selector selects all elements with that class attribute. Elements can only have one ID, but many classes.
2.HTMLviewer: <mat id='q1'><book id='q2'><book class='moved' id='q8' /><book class='small moved' id='q9'/></book></mat> <mat id='q3'><book class='small' id='q4'/></mat> <book id='q5'/> <book class='small' id='q10'> <book class='small moved' id='q6' /></book>
